result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrell Damond Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner, Montrell Damond Jackson appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Daniel Murphy
Deputy Court Clerk:  RT
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by  counsel and petitioner.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.

Defendant Montrell Damond Jackson in court.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for return of property hearing. Statements made. As to reasons placed on the record court orders the following: State to write a letter brief and defendant to bring proof of ownership. 
Matter adjourned in Branch 24.  Return of property hearing scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Return of property hearing on February 22, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Montrell Damond Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Court ordered State to provide photos to defense within 14 days of today's date. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or drug paraphernalia.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Montrell Damond Jackson in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/19/15 @ 1:30 pm
